info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 20 at 7:58PM CDT by NWS Aberdeen SD
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Aberdeen SD has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Dakota...
Oak Creek near Wakpala affecting Corson County.
.For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring.
* WHERE...Oak Creek near Wakpala.
* WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, The water reaches the bottom of the bridge just northwest of the gage.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 PM MDT Tuesday was 10.3 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr.
The next statement will be issued by late Wednesday night at 300 AM MDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
